title: When to Involve the Team
content: Not every decision benefits from team input. Routine decisions, time-critical choices, and clear authority situations don't require consensus. Complex decisions, novel situations, and high-stakes choices with time available benefit from collective thinking. Know when to decide alone and when to involve others.

mcq.question: You face a complex technical decision with significant business impact. You have 2 days to decide. Should you involve the team?

options.A: No—you have authority and should decide
options.B: Yes—complexity and stakes warrant collective input
options.C: Only if you don't know what to do
options.D: Get their input but make the final call alone

mcq.explanation: Complex, high-stakes decisions with adequate time benefit from team involvement. Multiple perspectives improve quality and build commitment to the outcome.

openQuestions: What criteria do you use to decide whether to involve others?
When has team input significantly changed a decision you would have made alone?
